keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)

docs.lead_paragraph: The latest allegations suggest problems further down Apple’s supply chain in China, among the manufacturers that account for 97 percent of Apple’s component costs.

headline.main: Groups Accuse Apple Supplier in China of Labor Violations
headline.print_headline: Groups Accuse Apple Supplier in China of Labor Violations

docs.abstract: Apple faces new accusations of violations of labor rights and workplace safety at one of its Chinese suppliers; investigations by Green America and China Labor Watch found that employees at factory owned by Catcher Technology in eastern China are made to work excessive overtime and handle toxic chemicals without proper protective clothing.
docs.snippet: The latest allegations suggest problems further down Apple’s supply chain in China, among the manufacturers that account for 97 percent of Apple’s component costs.

byline.contributor: Neil Gough reported from Hong Kong and Brian X. Chen from San Francisco.
byline.original: By NEIL GOUGH and BRIAN X. CHEN

docs.lead_paragraph: An unknown hacker or hackers broke into a computer server supporting the HealthCare.gov website through which consumers enroll in Obamacare health insurance, a government cybersecurity team discovered last week, apparently uploading malicious files.

headline.main: Hackers Break Into Server for Obamacare Website: U.S. Officials
headline.print_headline: Hackers Break Into Server for Obamacare Website: U.S. Officials

docs.snippet: An unknown hacker or hackers broke into a computer server supporting the HealthCare.gov website through which consumers enroll in Obamacare health insurance, a government cybersecurity team discovered last week, apparently uploading malicious files.

docs.abstract: Are they pressured to leave time off unused, or do they enjoy work more than play?
docs.snippet: Are they pressured to leave time off unused, or do they enjoy work more than play?

docs.lead_paragraph: Hackers successfully breached HealthCare.gov, but no consumer information was taken from the health insurance website that serves more than 5 million Americans, the Obama administration disclosed Thursday.
docs.snippet: Hackers successfully breached HealthCare.gov, but no consumer information was taken from the health insurance website that serves more than 5 million Americans, the Obama administration disclosed Thursday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Borrowing a Republican idea, a group including former senior Obama and Clinton advisers is unveiling a novel proposal to let states take the lead in controlling health costs.

headline.main: Democrats Borrow a GOP Idea on Health Care Costs
headline.print_headline: Democrats Borrow a GOP Idea on Health Care Costs

docs.snippet: Borrowing a Republican idea, a group including former senior Obama and Clinton advisers is unveiling a novel proposal to let states take the lead in controlling health costs.

docs.lead_paragraph: Germans are much more worried about how the lingering effects of the euro zone crisis will impact their pockets than the risk of getting involved in foreign conflicts like Ukraine, according to an annual survey of German angst released on Thursday.

headline.main: Euro Bailouts Cause Germans More Angst Than Ukraine-Poll
headline.print_headline: Euro Bailouts Cause Germans More Angst Than Ukraine-Poll

docs.snippet: Germans are much more worried about how the lingering effects of the euro zone crisis will impact their pockets than the risk of getting involved in foreign conflicts like Ukraine, according to an annual survey of German angst released on Thursday.

docs.lead_paragraph: The federal appeals court in Washington threw out a ruling Thursday that called into question the subsidies that help millions of low- and middle-income people afford their premiums under the president's health care law.

headline.main: Court Grants Obama Plea to Re-Hear Health Case
headline.print_headline: Court Grants Obama Plea to Re-Hear Health Case

docs.snippet: The federal appeals court in Washington threw out a ruling Thursday that called into question the subsidies that help millions of low- and middle-income people afford their premiums under the president's health care law.

docs.lead_paragraph: Giving another chance to a key part of the Obamacare health law, a U.S. appeals court on Thursday threw out a decision it made in July that threatened to limit the availability of federal health insurance subsidies for millions of people.

headline.main: U.S. Court to Rehear Obamacare Case; White House Welcomes Ruling
headline.print_headline: U.S. Court to Rehear Obamacare Case; White House Welcomes Ruling

docs.snippet: Giving another chance to a key part of the Obamacare health law, a U.S. appeals court on Thursday threw out a decision it made in July that threatened to limit the availability of federal health insurance subsidies for millions of people.

docs.lead_paragraph: The nation's respite from troublesome health care inflation is ending, the government said Wednesday in a report that renews a crucial budget challenge for lawmakers, taxpayers, businesses and patients.

headline.main: Pace of Health Care Spending Likely to Speed Up
headline.print_headline: Pace of Health Care Spending Likely to Speed Up

docs.snippet: The nation's respite from troublesome health care inflation is ending, the government said Wednesday in a report that renews a crucial budget challenge for lawmakers, taxpayers, businesses and patients.
